meta.name: Extract Gmail Metadata to Google Sheets

name: Extract Gmail Meta data into Google Sheet

parameters.content:
## It extracts useful details (like name, email, subject, and message) from incoming emails or form submissions â€” even if the data format varies.

ðŸ§© Step-by-Step Explanation:
âœ… 1. Get the Subject:
Looks for a subject line in multiple possible fields:

$json.subject, $json.Subject, $json.headers.subject

If none found â†’ sets it to "No Subject"

âœ… 2. Get the Message Body:
Looks for the main message in common fields:

$json.body, $json.text, $json.snippet

If none found â†’ "No message found."

âœ… 3. Get the "From" Information:
Checks where the message came from:

$json.from, $json.From, $json.headers.from

âœ… 4. Extract Name & Email:
If the sender is in format like:

John Doe <john@example.com>

It will:

senderName = "John Doe"

email = "john@example.com"

If only an email is provided (like john@example.com), it just sets the email.

âœ… 5. Try to Extract Name from the Message:
If the message body has something like:

Hi, I am Alice Johnson from XYZ Agency.

It will extract "Alice Johnson" as the name.

âœ… 6. Choose the Final Name:
Order of priority:

Name from message body ("I am ___ from...")

Name from the email header (John Doe)

If not found â†’ "Unknown"

âœ… 7. Return Structured Data:
The final output is:

{
  name: "Alice Johnson",
  email: "john@example.com",
  subject: "Website Inquiry",
  message: "Hi, I am Alice Johnson from XYZ...",
  timestamp: "2025-07-20T09:22:10.121Z"
}
## Gmail Triggers when the new email has came

## What This Automation Flow Does (in Simple Terms)

This automation is designed to process incoming customer emails, extract the important details, and store them in Airtable or any system you like â€” automatically, without any manual copy-pasting or data cleaning.


---

âš™ Tools Used

n8n: Automation platform where the entire workflow is built.

Airtable: Used as a database to store all the extracted customer data in a structured table format.



---

ðŸ“¦ Complete Flow Breakdown (Step-by-Step)

1. Trigger - New Email Received

The flow starts when a new email arrives. This could be:

A contact form submission from your Shopify store

A customer sending you a question or feedback

A support request


Node Used: IMAP/Email Trigger


---

2. Custom JavaScript Code - Smart Data Extraction

This is the core logic where we:

Extract the sender's email address and name (even if hidden inside angled brackets like John <john@email.com>)

Clean the subject line and message body

Use fallback values like "No Subject" or "No message found" when content is missing

Extract names from phrases like "Hi, Iâ€™m Alex" if available in the message

Add a timestamp to track when the message came in


Node Used: Function Node
Purpose: Makes the data clean, structured, and usable â€” no junk text or broken formatting.


---

3. Send to Airtable (or any CRM)

Once the data is extracted and cleaned:

It is sent directly to your Airtable base (or CRM/Sheet/Database)

One row per message, including Name, Email, Subject, Message, and Timestamp


Node Used: Airtable - Create Record
(You can also add filters or conditional routing if needed)


---

ðŸ’¡ Why This Is Valuable to You as a Store Owner

âœ… Saves hours of manual work: No need to check emails, copy details, and paste them into spreadsheets or CRMs

âœ… Never miss a lead: Every message is captured and stored in one place

âœ… Clean, structured data: No more messy email threads â€” just clear info you can act on

âœ… Scalable: Works whether you get 10 messages a day or 1,000

âœ… Expandable: Later you can auto-send replies, tag messages, or forward to your team



---

ðŸ§  Bonus: Why the Code Logic Matters

The JavaScript in the Function node is like a smart assistant:

It understands where to find data, even if email formats are different

It removes guesswork, keeps things clean, and ensures nothing breaks downstream

Itâ€™s future-proof â€” you donâ€™t have to update every time someone sends an email slightly differently



---

ðŸ“ˆ Final Result

You get a real-time dashboard of every incoming customer message stored neatly â€” ready for follow-up, reporting, or automation.
